Name: Daiquiri (Emilio Gonzalez's blended No. 1)
Ingredients: 60 ml Light gold rum (1-3 year old molasses column)
15 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
Instructions: BLEND all ingredients with 6oz scoop of crushed ice. Pour into glass and serve.
Review: Great on a hot day, but the coldness masks much of the flavour evident when this drink is served 'up' or natural.
History: Emilio Gonzalez is said to have adapted the Natural Daiquiri into this frozen version at the Plaza Hotel in Cuba. However, Constantino "Constante" Ribalaïgua Vert of  Havana's famous El Floridita made the drink famous. See Daiquiri cocktail history and variations
Nutrition: One serving of Daiquiri (Emilio Gonzalez's blended No. 1) contains 197 calories
